revised_title: Vertebrate Dispersal and Phytochemical Analysis of Arillate Seeds in Aglaia
tldr: This study examines the ecological and phytochemical aspects of arillate seeds in the Aglaia genus of tropical trees. The research focuses on the role of vertebrate animals in seed dispersal and the analysis of arils in six Aglaia species and four other plants. The findings reveal that bird-dispersed Aglaia seeds have a high lipid content, while primate-dispersed species have higher levels of free carbohydrates. The results contribute to the understanding of seed dispersal mechanisms in tropical rainforests.
